intro: Heterotropa hisauchii, commonly known as the Japanese heterotropa, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
